title-group.article-title: Hurdle Rates for Screening Capital Expenditure Proposals

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1975 Board of Regents of the University of Wisconsin System

abstract.p: This paper presents the results of a survey designed to seek information on how industrial firms set hurdle rates for use in capital budgeting. Larger firms often use different discount rates in different divisions and for different types of projects, but procedures for measuring risk are not considered accurate enough to warrant use of unique risk-adjusted discount rates for individual projects.
